docs.snippet: The Disunion question occupied the attention of both Houses of Congress yesterday, to the exclusion of all other business. In the Senate, Mr. LATHAM, of California, presented a memorial from the Chamber of Commerce of San Francisco, asking for the...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Disunion question occupied the attention of both Houses of Congress yesterday, to the exclusion of all other business. In the Senate, Mr. LATHAM, of California, presented a memorial from the Chamber of Commerce of San Francisco, asking for the establishment of a daily Overland Mail, but it was laid over for the present. Mr. POWELL,

docs.snippet: The Board met last evening. In the absence of the President, Councilman PERLEY took the Chair. The minutes of the previous meeting were read and approved.

headline.main: BOARD OF COUNCILMEN.; MORE DEPLETION OF THE CITY TREASURY.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Board met last evening. In the absence of the President, Councilman PERLEY took the Chair. The minutes of the previous meeting were read and approved.

headline.main: LAW REPORTS.; Court Calendar For FRIDAY. TRIAL OF MORRISETT FOR MURDER. THE DEFENCE. CHARGE TO THE GRAND JURY. Court of General Sessions. LARCENY EFFECTS OF A "SPREE." RAIL FORFEITED. The prisoner not being present, his bail was forfeited a "MONOMANIAC' CONVICTED OF FALSE PRETANCES. CALENDAR.
The Empress of the French in Edinburgh.; From the Scotsman. From the Times.
THE INDIANS.; Report of Hon. H.B. Greenwood, Commissioner of Indian Affairs.

docs.snippet: The Board of Aldermen failed to hold their regular meeting last evening for want of a quorum. They assemble to-day at 12 M., as canvassers, to count the votes received at the election on Tuesday.

headline.main: CITY AND COUNTY AFFAIRS.; THE BOARD OF ALDERMEN.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Board of Aldermen failed to hold their regular meeting last evening for want of a quorum. They assemble to-day at 12 M., as canvassers, to count the votes received at the election on Tuesday.

docs.snippet: The question of disunion was still further debated in the Senate yesterday. After some unimportant preliminary business, Mr. GREEN, of Missouri, introduced a resolution instructing the Judiciary Committee to inquire into the propriety of establishing...
docs.lead_paragraph: The question of disunion was still further debated in the Senate yesterday. After some unimportant preliminary business, Mr. GREEN, of Missouri, introduced a resolution instructing the Judiciary Committee to inquire into the propriety of establishing an armed police in border States, to maintain the general peace and to execute more effectually the Fugitive Slave law. On motion of Mr. CAMERON, of Pennsylvania, it was made the special order for Monday next.

headline.main: NATIONAL AFFAIRS.; Important Documents Before Congress. THE MESSAGE OF PRESIDENT BUCHANAN. Report of the Secretary of the Treasury and the Secretary of the Navy. THE PRESIDENT'S MESSAGE.
